data.title: Zhoushan Court Concludes USDT-Related Crime Case
data.description:
According to Foresight News, the Zhoushan Dinghai Court recently concluded a case involving the use of USDT transactions for criminal activities. Between October 2022 and August 2023, an individual named Huang organized a group, including Yao, Guo, Yu, and others, to register multiple 'businesses' on a foreign virtual currency platform. They profited through joint dividends and buying USDT at low prices to sell high.

The court noted that the suspects were aware of potential illegal activities upstream in the transactions. Despite this, they used employee WeChat accounts to receive transfers from victims Gan and Wen, subsequently depositing Tether into designated accounts to facilitate the transfer of funds related to telecom fraud and other crimes. During this period, the 'businesses' frequently encountered WeChat account suspensions and freezes due to suspected fraud. The involved parties resorted to fabricating false transaction screenshots and courier numbers to unfreeze accounts or switched accounts to evade regulation.

The Dinghai Court considered the roles of each defendant in the joint crime, their restitution efforts, and their attitudes towards admitting guilt. Huang was sentenced to two years and eleven months in prison and fined 50,000 yuan for aiding information network criminal activities. Nine accomplices, including Yao and Guo, received sentences ranging from seven months to two years and three months, all with probation, and were fined. The court ordered the return of 877,000 yuan in seized illicit funds to the victims, and the confiscation of mobile phones, hard drives, and other tools used in the crime.

data.title: FTX Creditors Repaid at 2022 Prices, Miss Massive Gains on SOL and BTC
data.description:
In recent crypto news, On-chain detective ZachXBT called out FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried for misrepresenting the recovery process. This was after SBF posted on social media claiming “this is where the money went. ” For context, creditors of the cryptocurrency exchange FTX are receiving repayments based on asset values from the November 2022 bankruptcy filing
source: https://www.thecoinrepublic.com/2025/11/01/ftx-creditors-repaid-at-2022-prices-miss-massive-gains-on-sol-and-btc/

data.title: The US Solana spot ETF saw a net inflow of $44.48 million today, marking the fourth consecutive day of net inflows.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, on October 31st (Eastern Time), the US Solana spot ETF saw a total net inflow of $44.48 million, marking the fourth consecutive day of net inflows. The Bitwise Solana spot ETF (BSOL) also saw a single-day net inflow of $44.48 million, with a historical total net inflow of $197 million. The Grayscale Solana spot ETF (GSOL) saw no net inflows or outflows. As of press time, the total net asset value of the Solana spot ETFs was $502 million, with a net asset value ratio of 0.49%, and a historical cumulative net inflow of $199 million.

data.title: The Dinghai District Court of Zhoushan City has concluded a case involving Tether (USDT) and aiding and abetting cybercrime, with the amount of money involved exceeding 5 million yuan.
data.description: The Dinghai District Court in Zhoushan, Zhejiang Province, concluded a case involving an accomplice in the Tether (Tether) cryptocurrency scandal. The defendant registered multiple "businesses" on an overseas cryptocurrency platform, profiting through joint ventures and profit-sharing schemes involving buying low and selling high with Tether. Knowing that illegal activities might exist upstream in the transactions, the defendant still assisted in transferring funds related to telecommunications fraud and other crimes, accumulating over 5 million yuan in payments and settlements related to cybercrime. This was deemed a "serious offense," and the defendant was sentenced to imprisonment and fined. The 877,000 yuan in seized funds was returned to the victims. (Zhoushan Dinghai Court Official WeChat Account)

data.title: Binance token deposits now support Chinese input.
data.description: According to information on the relevant page, Binance has now added Chinese input support to its token deposit function. Users can directly use Chinese to search for and input token names after updating the app.

data.title: Resolution Proposed to Restrict Digital Asset Involvement by U.S. Officials
data.description:
According to Foresight News, California Democratic Representative Ro Khanna has introduced a resolution aimed at supporting legislation to prohibit the issuance, sponsorship, or endorsement of digital assets by the President, Vice President, members of Congress, public office candidates, public officials, senior executive branch employees, special government employees, and their immediate family members. This includes cryptocurrencies, meme coins, stablecoins, tokens, NFTs, digital trading cards, and DeFi platforms.

The resolution also advocates for elected officials, candidates, and their immediate family members to transfer their digital assets into a blind trust, which would be inaccessible during the politician's candidacy, tenure, and for two years after leaving office. Additionally, it supports the requirement for politicians, candidates, and their families to fully and promptly disclose all cryptocurrency transactions.

Fox News reports that the resolution is unlikely to pass in the House of Representatives due to the Republican majority. Furthermore, even if the resolution is approved, it would still need to undergo the legislative process to be enacted into law.

data.title: An address suspected to be Bitmine or SharpLink increased its holdings by 9272 ETH.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, about 40 minutes ago, a newly created wallet received 9,272 ETH from Galaxy Digital, worth approximately $35.77 million. It is very likely that the wallet belongs to Bitmine, the largest holder of Ethereum, or SharpLink, the second largest holder.

data.title: ZEC's market capitalization surpasses $7 billion, setting a new all-time high.
data.description: According to Coingecko data, Zcash (ZEC) has surpassed $7 billion in market capitalization, currently reaching $7,024,688,989, setting a new all-time high with a 24-hour increase of 18.9%. It is understood that Zcash is about to undergo a halving, and the expected issuance will decrease significantly.

data.title: Malaysia's Central Bank Launches Asset Tokenization Initiative
data.description:
According to PANews, Malaysia's central bank has initiated a three-year exploration program focused on the tokenization of real-world assets. This initiative includes the establishment of a digital asset innovation center and an industry working group to gather feedback on potential applications, ranging from supply chain finance to Islamic financial products.

The central bank's latest report outlines a phased implementation plan, beginning with proof-of-concept and pilot projects in 2026, followed by an expansion of trials in 2027. The bank has invited industry stakeholders to submit application case opinions by March 1, 2026, while also specifying which cases meet the experimental conditions.

data.title: Ansem: Buying ZEC at $432 is like buying Bitcoin at $432.
data.description: As ZEC briefly broke through $430, crypto KOL Ansem posted on the X platform, stating, "Buying Zcash (ZEC) at $432 is just like buying Bitcoin at $432."

data.title: Pump.fun launches Spotlight, a utility token-backed program.
data.description:
Pump.fun has announced the launch of its Utility Token Support Program, "Spotlight," to help utility tokens without meme attributes gain more attention and liquidity to support startups and projects.

Furthermore, Pump.fun stated that the program will screen teams whose tokens have practical value within the ecosystem and are integrated into the company's long-term strategy, and will assist these teams in developing issuance plans. Applications for the Spotlight program are now open.

data.title: Romania blacklisted Polymarket for operating without a license.
data.description: Romanian authorities have blacklisted Polymarket for operating without a license. The Romanian National Gaming Authority (ONJN) determined that betting on prediction markets constituted counterparty betting, not trading. In Romania, the gambling industry is a state monopoly, and operators must apply for and obtain a license from the ONJN to operate. The ONJN director stated in a press release, "The decision to blacklist Polymarket is not related to technology, but to the law." (DL News)
